metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7511 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Libgcrypt before 1.6.5 does not properly perform elliptic-point curve multiplication during decryption, which makes it easier for physically proximate attackers to extract ECDH keys by measuring electromagnetic emanations.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7511` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgcrypt11 - 1.5.3-2ubuntu4.3
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Daniel Genkin, Lev Pachmanov, Itamar Pipman and Eran Tromer

criterions.comment: libgcrypt11 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.3-2ubuntu4.3').
libgcrypt20: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
